New Records: Giancarlo Stanton reached 25 homers for the 10th time in his big league career
Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole struck out nine over six innings before his right calf cramped
Aaron Judge doubled for his MLB-best 124th RBI
Gleyber Torres had three hits for the AL-leading Yankees, including a two-run double in the third inning
Anthony Rizzo had a two-run double in their five-run sixth inning
Aaron Volpe made a diving backhand stop behind second base on Marcus Semien's grounder and threw to first for the out
Post-Match Reflections: Gerrit Cole said he wasn't super concerned about his calf cramp and thought it wasn't the right situation to keep trying to manipulate it out there
Giancarlo Stanton said it's pretty cool to have reached 25 homers for the 10th time in his career, but what's most important is helping the team win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees (80-58) remained a half-game ahead of Baltimore in the AL East
Aaron Judge swung at and missed an 84 mph curveball from Jack Leiter
Jack Leiter pitched into the sixth inning for the first time in five big league starts
Luke Weaver took over for Gerrit Cole and immediately allowed a single to Josh Jung and a homer to Wyatt Langford
Others: Clarke Schmidt (right lat strain) struck out seven without a walk while allowing two runs over 4 2/3 innings in a rehab start for Double-A Somerset
Luis Gil (lower back strain) is expected to rejoin the rotation this week
Jacob deGrom (elbow surgery rehab) and Max Scherzer (shoulder fatigue/nerve issue) are both scheduled to make rehab starts Saturday
